reg.title: Slaughter House Regulation
reg.amsincluded: [includes amendments up to B.C. Reg. 356/2004, September 1, 2004]

definition.def: means approved in writing by a medical health officer or a public health inspector;

means a condition or circumstance that has or may have an adverse effect on the health of a person, and includes a condition or circumstance that is insanitary or which prevents or hinders the suppression of disease;
means inspected by a medical health officer or a public health inspector;
means the person operating a slaughter house, and includes the owner.

section.sectiontext: This regulation applies with respect to a slaughter house only if the slaughter house

paragraph.paragraphtext: is located in an area of the Province located outside all the areas set out in Column 2 of the schedule to this regulation, and
is operating at the time this section comes into force.

section.sectiontext: No person who is an operator shall

paragraph.paragraphtext: operate or manage a slaughter house, or
permit any premises, building, structure, equipment, utensil or other thing used in or as part of a slaughter house to be so used

section.subsandwich: except in accordance with the standards and requirements of this regulation.

subsection.subsectiontext: No person shall construct, convert or establish a building into or for use as a slaughter house unless its plans and specifications have been first approved.
No person shall operate a slaughter house until it has first been inspected and approved.
Every slaughter house shall be inspected as often as is necessary in the interests of public health and safety, to ensure compliance with this regulation and the Act.

Animals intended for slaughter and all fresh meat exposed for sale shall be inspected as often as may be necessary in the interests of public health and safety, and to ensure compliance with this regulation and the Act.

paragraph.paragraphtext: yards and pens with shelter for cattle and appliances and conveniences for feeding and watering them,
a killing floor,
a refrigerated storage room with a separate hanging room,
proper and adequate appliances for killing animals and for cleaning and hanging their carcasses, for heating water for removal of blood and offal, and for receiving the organs and fat,
an adequate supply of pure water for flushing and general cleansing purposes,
sufficient and proper appliances for heating and ventilation,
thorough and adequate ventilation, and
an approved sewage disposal system and method of waste disposal, sufficient in each case to prevent a health hazard arising.

section.sectiontext: The ground on which a slaughter house is to be situated shall be selected for its dryness, and, where necessary, subsoil water shall be carried away by a 7.6 cm (3 inch) field tile laid

paragraph.paragraphtext: around the outside of the foundation of the building, and
lower than the floor of the building.

section.sectiontext: The floors in a slaughter house shall be laid on a foundation of

paragraph.paragraphtext: concrete and constructed from concrete with roughened surface, or
other material impervious to water.

section.sectiontext: No building occupied in whole or in part as a slaughter house shall be occupied at any time as a dwelling or lodging place.

Where, in a slaughter house, persons treat or handle meat, refuse, offal, fertilizer or any other materials derived directly or indirectly from the slaughtering of animals, the floors at that location shall be made of water tight, non-absorbent material, properly drained, and the walls of every killing room, meat dressing room and cooling room shall be finished with non-absorbent material that facilitates easy cleaning.
The yards, other than where cattle are kept, shall be

paragraph.paragraphtext: constructed so as not to absorb liquid filth, and
graded so as to permit controlled drainage.

section.sectiontext: All interior woodwork shall be painted.

subsection.subsectiontext: Blood from slaughtered animals shall, while still fresh, be treated so as not to become offensive.

All offensive odours arising from the handling of meat and the treating of and caring for offal, blood or any other material stored or manufactured shall be immediately extinguished and not allowed to escape into the outside air.

section.marginalnote: Pits and wells in slaughter house
section.sectiontext: No blood pit, dung pit or privy well shall remain or be constructed within any slaughter house, and no accumulation of any refuse whatever, when tainted or emitting a noxious odour, shall be permitted to remain in or around a slaughter house.
The contents of any manure pit or manure pile on the premises shall be removed as often as necessary to prevent a health hazard arising.

paragraph.paragraphtext: in a state unfit to be slaughtered for the purpose of selling its meat for human food, or
in a diseased condition

section.subsandwich: shall be slaughtered for the purpose of selling its meat for human food.

paragraph.paragraphtext: found to be diseased or unwholesome, or
from

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: a calf less than 3 weeks old when killed,
a lamb less than 8 weeks old when killed,
a piglet less than 5 weeks old when killed, or

section.subsandwich: the meat shall not be used for human food.

section.sectiontext: Animals, other than those intended for slaughter, shall not be kept in or around slaughter houses.
Animals intended for slaughter shall not be kept for a longer period than 48 hours in or around a slaughter house.
